USER: [{'tool_use_id': 'toolu_014cKTKA6FFjCkwM68Ndb5YE', 'type': 'tool_result', 'content': '### Step 3: Git Sync Protocol
```bash
# Check which node we're on
NODE_IP=$(hostname -I | grep -oE '100\.110\.82\.(181|245|250)' | head -n1)

cd /mnt/Wolf-code/Wolf-Ai-Enterptises/Wolf-Logic-MCP

if [ "$NODE_IP" = "100.110.82.181" ]; then
  # On 181: Push to GitLab
  git push gitlab main
  echo "Node 181 - pushed to GitLab"
elif [ "$NODE_IP" = "100.110.82.245" ]; then
  # On 245: Pull from GitLab
  git pull gitlab main
  echo "Node 245 - pulled from GitLab"
elif [ "$NODE_IP" = "100.110.82.250" ]; then
  # On 250: GitLab server - pull to sync working directory
  git pull gitlab main
  echo "Node 250 - working directory synced"
fi
```', 'is_error': False}]

ASSISTANT: [THINKING]
Perfect! Let me check for the GitLab remote configuration and working directory sections as well.

user.content:
### Step 3: Git Sync Protocol
```bash
# Check which node we're on
NODE_IP=$(hostname -I | grep -oE '100\.110\.82\.(181|245|250)' | head -n1)

cd /mnt/Wolf-code/Wolf-Ai-Enterptises/Wolf-Logic-MCP

if [ "$NODE_IP" = "100.110.82.181" ]; then
  # On 181: Push to GitLab
  git push gitlab main
  echo "Node 181 - pushed to GitLab"
elif [ "$NODE_IP" = "100.110.82.245" ]; then
  # On 245: Pull from GitLab
  git pull gitlab main
  echo "Node 245 - pulled from GitLab"
elif [ "$NODE_IP" = "100.110.82.250" ]; then
  # On 250: GitLab server - pull to sync working directory
  git pull gitlab main
  echo "Node 250 - working directory synced"
fi
```
